title: Westlife EXCLUSIVE: Mark Feehily discusses the 'complex journey' of surrogacy after Layla's birth
text:
He welcomed his first child earlier this month with fiancé Cailean O'Neill.

And Mark Feehily has spoke about his newborn daughter Layla as he discussed the 'complex journey' of surrogacy in an exclusive interview with MailOnline.

The Westlife star, 39, also refused to reveal who the biological father is of Layla saying that the 'relevant thing is that the both of us are her parents'.

New fathers: Mark Feehily has spoke about his newborn daughter Layla as he discussed the 'complex journey' of surrogacy (pictured with fiancé Cailean O'Neill after Layla's birth)

Talking exclusively to MailOnline as part of the release of Westlife’s new single My Blood, Mark said: 'Surrogacy is a complex journey. Even the vocabulary used around it.

'I would say there’s a surrogate who’s given us the gift of carrying our child for us, an egg donor that played a part in the journey, and we’re the fathers.'

He added: 'For now that’s the information that I wanna put out there. Maybe at some point I’ll find a relevant reason to get into detail, but for me the relevant thing is that the both of us are her parents.'

While bandmate Nicky Byrne exclaimed: 'Can I just say... that last five minutes is the evolution of Westlife.

Smitten: The Westlife star, 39, also refused to reveal who the biological father is of Layla saying that the 'relevant thing is that the both of us are her parents' (pictured with Cailean)

'I remember sitting in these situations answering what my favourite pizza topping was for Smash Hits magazine, and now we’re talking about surrogacy.'

Mark revealed that he didn't even tell close family friends the exact due date of Layla and that it is a journey he has been 'researching and preparing for years'.

Luckily for the singer, his bandmates have been on hand to share their fatherhood tips - Shane Filan has Nicole, 14, Patrick, 11, and Shane, nine; Nicky Byrne has twins Rocco and Jay, 12, and Gia, six; while Kian Egan has Koa, seven, and Zeke, four.

Mark said ahead of Layla's birth: 'The lads have given me loads of advice. A lot of the advice is, until you have the baby in your arms there’s not much you can do.

Complex: Talking exclusively to MailOnline, Mark said: 'Surrogacy is a complex journey. Even the vocabulary used around it.' (pictured with Layla's scan in May)

'Kian gave me car seat advice and then I was up until about half two looking into car seats. This is what my world is inhabited with at the moment.

‘But it’s a lot of fun and I’m under no illusion that it’ll be easy and it’ll be all fun and games, but I can’t wait.'

Mark also discussed having more children with his fiancé Cailean but insisted they will take it 'one step at a time'.

He said: 'I'm so sensible. At the start of the band, the lads went to pick a Ferrari each. I have the same Jeep I’ve had for seven years.

Sweet: Luckily for the singer, his bandmates have been on hand to share their fatherhood tips with Kian Egan offering car seat advice (pictured together on stage in May)

'I’m so overly sensible, I’ve had to fight against my overly sensible self. So, one kid at a time and see how it feels. I will do it one step at a time.'

Mark went on to talk about his wedding to fiancé Cailean, insisting that they are in 'no rush' to get married and that they would like daughter Layla to walk down the aisle with them.

The lovebirds became engaged in February this year during an idyllic getaway after six happy years together. At the time, Mark divulged it would be the 'dream' to become a father and have his own kids 'running around' him.

He sweetly said: 'I'll be honest with you, with the engagement and the baby, that’s a lot of excitement to deal with before you add in a 50-date Westlife tour, and recording an album or anything.

'So, we’re in no rush to get a wedding planned in the immediate future. Personally, I love the thought of the little girl [Layla] walking down the aisle, so we’ll have to just wait and see. So, there’s no date planned.'

Mark welcomed his daughter Layla on the 1 October and took to Instagram to reveal he had become a father with fiancé Cailean in a heartwarming post.

He added the caption: 'Baby Layla born safe & sound @ 7.27pm on October 1st 2019! We’re the happiest Dads in the world! x'.

The couple announced that they are expecting their first child in May before revealing in July that they were set to welcome a girl.

Westlife’s new single My Blood is released today. The forthcoming album Spectrum is set for release on 15 November. It is available for pre-order at Westlife.com now.
description: The Westlife star, 39, also refused to reveal who the biological father is of Layla saying that the 'relevant thing is that the both of us are her parents'.
